April 2025 County of Marin EMS E 5
DROWNING / SUBMERSION
Indications
Immersion in water with altered mental status and/or respiratory impairment
Yes No
In Cardiac Arrest?
Obtain rectal temp ALS RMC
If rectal If rectal • Ensure patent airway
temp <95°F temp >95°F • Protect cervical spine if
neck injury suspected
• Go to Cold • Go to Cardiac
Induced Arrest, C 0
Injury, E 2
• High flow oxygen. Prepare
to support ventilations with
appropriate airway adjuncts
• CPAP if available
SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS Anticipate vomiting: take
precautions against aspiration
• If patient presents in full arrest and is
and be prepared to suction
normothermic, treat as cardiac arrest
• If patient is hypothermic (<95°F), refer to
Cold Induced Injury policy (E 2)
• Priority should be given to ventilation and
airway control over C-spine immobilization.
• Remove wet clothing
SMR should be used judicially
• Keep patient warm and dry
